pullRequest.title: Document server and HTTP server log properties
pullRequest.bodyText:
Aimed to fix #477
Descriptions are a bit of a guess...

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -681,3 +681,44 @@ The following properties allow tuning the :doc:`/functions/regexp`.
     to hit the limit on matches for subsequent rows as well, you want to use the
     correct algorithm from the beginning so as not to waste time and resources.
     The more rows you are processing, the larger this value should be.
+
+
+Logging Properties
+------------------
+
+Presto uses the server application framework `Airlift
+<https://github.com/airlift/airlift>`_ and therefore supports its configuration
+properties for the HTTP server and general logging.
+
+``http-server.log.max-history``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``integer``
+    * **Default value:** ``15``
+
+    The maxiumum number of log files for the HTTP server to use, before
+    log rotation replaces old content.
+
+``http-server.log.max-size``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``data size``
+    * **Default value:** ``unlimited``
+
+    The maximum file size for the log file of the HTTP server.

nodes.bodyText:
Also document http-server.log.enabled, http-server.log.path
(HttpServerConfig in airlift)

nodes.bodyText:
it's relative to "data dir", which default to <installation dir>/data.
Can you please double check me by running Presto from unpacked tgz?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -681,3 +681,81 @@ The following properties allow tuning the :doc:`/functions/regexp`.
     to hit the limit on matches for subsequent rows as well, you want to use the
     correct algorithm from the beginning so as not to waste time and resources.
     The more rows you are processing, the larger this value should be.
+
+
+Logging Properties
+------------------
+
+Presto uses the server application framework `Airlift
+<https://github.com/airlift/airlift>`_ and therefore supports its configuration
+properties for the HTTP server and general logging.
+
+
+``http-server.log.enabled``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``boolean``
+    * **Default value:** ``true``
+
+    Flag to enable or disable logging for the HTTP server.
+
+``http-server.log.compression.enabled``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``boolean``
+    * **Default value:** ``true``
+
+    Flag to enable or disable compression of the log files of the HTTP server.
+
+``http-server.log.path``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``string``
+    * **Default value:** ``var/log/http-request.log``
+
+    The path to the log file used by the HTTP server. The default is relative to
+    the Presto installation folder.

+
+
+Logging Properties

+<https://github.com/airlift/airlift>`_ and therefore supports its configuration

nodes.bodyText:
i forgot to mention, RPM's default is /var/log/presto/server.log.
How/whether we document this?

@@ -681,3 +681,81 @@ The following properties allow tuning the :doc:`/functions/regexp`.
     to hit the limit on matches for subsequent rows as well, you want to use the
     correct algorithm from the beginning so as not to waste time and resources.
     The more rows you are processing, the larger this value should be.
+
+
+Logging Properties
+------------------
+
+Presto uses the server application framework `Airlift
+<https://github.com/airlift/airlift>`_ and therefore supports its configuration

+
+``log.path``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^

@@ -681,3 +681,81 @@ The following properties allow tuning the :doc:`/functions/regexp`.
     to hit the limit on matches for subsequent rows as well, you want to use the
     correct algorithm from the beginning so as not to waste time and resources.
     The more rows you are processing, the larger this value should be.
+
+
+Logging Properties
+------------------
+
+Presto uses the server application framework `Airlift
+<https://github.com/airlift/airlift>`_ and therefore supports its configuration
+properties for the HTTP server and general logging.
+
+``log.path``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``string``
+    * **Default value:** ``var/log/server.log``
+
+    The path to the log file used by Presto. The default is relative to
+    the Presto data directory.
+
+``log.max-history``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``integer``
+    * **Default value:** ``30``
+
+    The maximum number of general application log files to use, before log
+    rotation replaces old content.
+
+``log.max-size``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+    * **Type:** ``data size``
+    * **Default value:** ``100MB``
+
+    The maximum file size for the general application log file.
+
+
+``http-server.log.enabled``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``boolean``
+    * **Default value:** ``true``
+
+    Flag to enable or disable logging for the HTTP server.
+
+``http-server.log.compression.enabled``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``boolean``
+    * **Default value:** ``true``
+
+    Flag to enable or disable compression of the log files of the HTTP server.
+
+``http-server.log.path``
+^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
+
+    * **Type:** ``string``
+    * **Default value:** ``var/log/http-request.log``

commit.message: Document log properties and launcher options

afterCommit.message: Document log properties and launcher options
